file_content.text: I remember you, but I'm undercover. Can't talk right now.
Look who's coming back to visit! I wish I had time to talk, but I'm busy with another job.
Well now, look here, the hotshot's back after busting into the Justicars' base.
Did you find the holodisc, kid? Can I make a copy for my daughter?
Here--make your copy and give it back.
Yes.
I had a good feeling the minute I met you. A quick copy--and there's your holodisc. Easy enough.
You remember this: Undercity Assistance will use these secret passages to help people in need.
Coruscant needs all the help it can get right now.
That's good to hear.
It's time I left, then.
Like I care.
That's everything I needed.
Nice to work with someone who knows what they're doing. Now take that disc back so security can ignore it again.
I don't have anything for you.
No.
I'm not getting any younger. Bring those schematics to me before you finish with security, and we can help a lot of people.
What are you wasting time for? Get to the Justicars' base and get that holodisc.
What do you want? I'm just an old woman minding her own business. Haven't done nothing to no one.
I take it you're the Republic spy?
Security sent me to find you.
Not a very nice way to greet your support.
What's with the attitude?
Oh, so you're my backup! About time! I'm risking my neck loitering here!
Aren't you a little old for this kind of work?
How are you a spy?
If that's what you think, that's what everyone else will think, too. What kind of backup are you, anyway?
Republic security needs to get its act together! Downright insulting this has taken so long!
The lieutenant said you never contacted him.
You didn't report in.
He's never heard of "radio silence"? Idiot.
The important thing is that I'm here now.
Anger won't solve anything.
I'm grateful, Jedi, but you don't know what I put up with. Unbelievable.
You must be more patient.
Some things take time.
Due respect, Jedi, you don't have to deal with Republic security every day. I do.
I'm with Special Forces. I wasn't involved until now.
Don't look at me.
Special Forces, huh? Well, time to make yourself useful.
Trust me, I'm worth the wait.
You should be happy to see me.
I'll believe it when I see it, kid.
I'm only here because the guys from Republic security were too scared.
You're lucky I came at all.
Typical. They're worse than worthless.
Look, I tracked the data thieves down here, and I'm positive the Justicars took the schematics to their base. Probably to their main computer.
You do realize, though, that once you take the schematics back, they'll just gather dust in some security storeroom.
The Justicars would use the schematics to hurt people.
Better than leaving them here.
Sure, but I'm not suggesting you let it go.
Doesn't matter to me.
Well, I guess your loyalty isn't set in steel, then.
Well, yeah.
Hear me out on this... my daughter runs a relief group called "Undercity Assistance."
They bring food and supplies to the poor in the lower levels. These schematics would help them avoid the gangs down here.
Are you asking me to give you the schematics instead of returning them?
What are you suggesting?
No, no, not at all.
I don't see any reason you couldn't copy the maps you need.
We could share the schematics.
That's just what I was thinking.
The schematics belong to Republic security.
That data is confidential.
And they'll get them. After a little bit of sharing.
Just bring the holodisc back to me after you get it, and I can make a copy for my daughter.
You're asking me to betray Lieutenant Doorn.
This isn't my task.
For a good cause, yes. And that fool'll never know the difference.
If we make copies of that data, it could end up in the wrong hands.
Knowledge must be protected.
I'm not stupid. I trust my daughter not to spread the schematics around!
Command needs to decide these issues.
This isn't our call.
That's a joke! "Command" can't even decide what uniforms to wear.
This isn't the job I'm getting paid to do.
I'm not running a charity.
Either way, you'll get whatever credits security promised you.
I'll do it.
I think so.
Sorry, but no.
If you want them to go to waste, then fine. Go ahead and give them to Lieutenant Whatever-his-name-is.
You have all the information I can give. Go pay a visit to the Justicars--and if you want that data put to good use, I'll be here.
I don't know you, and even if I did, I wouldn't want to be seen talking to you.
